title: Continual Learning of Large Language Models: A Survey

sections.description: Introduce the topic of continual learning in large language models (LLMs), highlighting its importance and relevance in the field of AI. Discuss the scope of the survey, including the focus on incremental learning, transfer learning, and model adaptation. Include a subsection 'Structure of the Survey' to outline the organization of the paper.

subsections.subsection title: Importance of Continual Learning in AI
subsections.description: Discuss the significance of continual learning in advancing AI capabilities and its role in enhancing the adaptability and efficiency of LLMs.
Define the boundaries of the survey, focusing on incremental learning, transfer learning, and model adaptation in LLMs.
Provide an overview of the paper's organization and the main topics covered in each section.

sections.description: Provide definitions and explanations of key concepts such as continual learning, incremental learning, transfer learning, and model adaptation. Discuss the significance of these concepts in the context of LLMs and their ability to learn continuously without forgetting.

subsections.description: Define continual learning and its importance in the context of LLMs.
Explain incremental learning and how it allows models to update with new data while retaining previous knowledge.
Discuss transfer learning and how it leverages knowledge from related tasks to improve learning efficiency.
Describe various strategies for adapting models to new environments, maintaining performance across tasks.

sections.description: Explore various methodologies used for enabling continual learning in LLMs. Discuss techniques such as incremental learning, transfer learning, and model adaptation.

subsections.description: Review existing frameworks and taxonomies for continual learning in LLMs.
Discuss the evaluation metrics and benchmarking methods used to assess continual learning in LLMs.

sections.description: Identify and discuss the challenges associated with continual learning in LLMs, such as catastrophic forgetting, distribution shifts, and resource constraints.

subsections.description: Examine the issue of catastrophic forgetting and its impact on model performance.
Discuss how distribution shifts affect continual learning and model reliability.
Highlight the resource constraints involved in implementing continual learning in LLMs.

sections.description: Examine strategies for adapting LLMs to new or evolving environments. Discuss approaches for adjusting models to maintain performance across different tasks and domains.

subsections.description: Explore techniques to reduce catastrophic forgetting in LLMs.
Discuss methods for enhancing knowledge transfer and fine-tuning instructions in LLMs.
Examine strategies for dynamic adaptation and domain-specific model tuning.
Discuss the use of memory and replay mechanisms to support continual learning.

sections.description: Present real-world applications and case studies that demonstrate the effectiveness of continual learning in LLMs.

subsections.description: Highlight the use of continual learning in programming and code generation tasks.
